page.title: 17FARMING
page.content: {FARMING}in North Leverton is on farms of approx 100 hectares of heavy clay land, fertile and water retaining. Wheat, barley, oilseed rape, peas, and grass are main crops. Intensive methods are used with very big fields and machines. One dairy farm. Cows use land near to farm. Fields at a distance for hay, silage and fresh feed. Milking parlour for 6 and feeding space for 120. Milk taken 30 miles to dairy. Hens for laying, 25,000 in cages. Duck rearing (some for export) number 4000 Game birds are reared. Farm buildings modern, cereals stored in specially constructed barns: straw in covered areas bales now circular and carried by lifters on tractors. Fattening of bullocks and sheep. There is a rotation of crops with grass used as the break crop.
